H0.text: The molecules will begin to move slower as an ice cube is placed in a heated pan.

H1.text: The molecules will begin to move faster as the ice cube is heated in the pan.

H2.text: The molecules will begin to increase in density as the ice cube is heated in the pan.

H3.text: The molecules will begin to condense in the air as the ice is heated when an ice cube is put into a heated pan.

A4.text: While melting, any energy added breaks the hydrogen bonds between ice (water) molecules.

A5.text: When water freezes, it increases in volume (about 9% for fresh water).
